reviews.text: trying this outlet for first time and, yes, Tiong Hoe still brews my fav pour over coffee in the country‚Ä¶

This branch is located inside FairPrice Finest Gourmet. Go to coffee spot when I‚Äôm running appointments around the area.
And it‚Äôs only $5.40 for a good cup of coffee in this location üëçüèº

There‚Äôs also a small outdoor seating area for those who enjoy their coffee on the spot.

Had coffee on national day. Didn't know the 1-for-1 national day offer/conditions but staff didn't mention too. Filtered coffees served on takeaway paper cups despite stating having coffees in. Of the two coffees we had, one was diluted and had none of the remaining taste notes. I learned later that there was no more beans for this coffee. Overall experience was one feeling cheated, not the same as previous experiences at Mei Ling St or Vivo branches.
Bought the handbrewed YIRGACHEFFE coffee  which was nice and smooth. too bad about the ambience as I couldn't observe the barista making the coffee unlike cafes like apartment and etc.

Nice little Specialty coffee corner inside Balmoral Fairprice, provide wide choice of espresso blend and single origin coffee bean on the shelf, some merchandise Hario V60 filter etc. On the menu usually have 2 choice of espresso blend for customers to choose for their respective drink, medium/low acidity or high acidity coffee. They using Hario V60 for pour over filter coffee too!
